title: What Checksum Algorithm used
content:
I have blocks 1 to 4 of an RFID card with 4-byte Hex data each. Block 5 contains some sort of 4-byte Hex data checksum which I would like to know how it was derived.
Please see the 3 sample data below:
(1)




Block
Data




Block 1
C9 09 1B 1B


Block 2
00 01 01 01


Block 3
64 64 DA 9C


Block 4
1A DA A3 00


Block 5
C7 60 01 E9




(2)




Block
Data




Block 1
C9 09 1B 1B


Block 2
00 01 01 01


Block 3
67 67 DA 9C


Block 4
1A DA A3 00


Block 5
DA 3D E6 E7




(3)




Block
Data




Block 1
C9 09 1B 1B


Block 2
00 01 01 01


Block 3
6A 6D DA 9C


Block 4
1A DA A3 00


Block 5
22 B7 DE 6F




Please note that only changes in block 3 1st and 2nd column data resulted in the changes shown in block 5 data in each of the sample.
Could anyone figure out how the checksums were calculated?
Many thanks in advance.

comments.text: As you assume it is a CRC have you checked that if block1-4 are identical you get the same block 5?
@Robert Many thanks for your response. Please note that if blocks 1-4 are identical, block 5 is the same. What other algorithm would you suggest that would result in 32 bits from 128 bit data?
Can you manipulate single Bytes in Block 3? Such as "65 64 DA 9C" "66 64 DA 9C" or "64 64 DA 9D" etc?

@ dieter reichl Many thanks for your response. The Bytes are generated by hardware (card writer) The only way I can manipulate the Bytes in  Block 3 is to rewrite the Bytes to the RFID card using another card writer, which I can readily do. Please note that a change to any of the Bytes in Blocks 1-4 requires a corresponding change to Block 5  Bytes as well.
